block.p: Elizabeth Roberts Wilcox, the daughter of Cynda B. Wilcox and Philip C. Wilcox of Bethesda, Md., was married yesterday to Eric Juien-Yi Pan, a son of Grace C. Pan of Pittsburgh and the late Dr. Yuan-Siang Pan. The Rev. Louise J. Lusignan performed the ceremony at St. Columba's Episcopal Church in Washington.
The couple received law degrees cum laude from Harvard University, where they met.

Elizabeth Roberts Wilcox, the daughter of Cynda B. Wilcox and Philip C. Wilcox of Bethesda, Md., was married yesterday to Eric Juien-Yi Pan, a son of Grace C. Pan of Pittsburgh and the late Dr. Yuan-Siang Pan. The Rev. Louise J. Lusignan performed the ceremony at St. Columba's Episcopal Church in Washington.
The couple received law degrees cum laude from Harvard University, where they met.

Ms. Wilcox, 32, is keeping her name. Until Wednesday, she was a lawyer in the general counsel's office of the Treasury Department in Washington. She is to join the office of the legal adviser at the State Department this month. The bride graduated magna cum laude from Yale and received a master's degree in international affairs from Columbia. Her father, a retired Foreign Service officer, was the consul general in Jerusalem from 1988 to 1991. In October, he is to become the president of the Foundation for Middle East Peace in Washington.

Mr. Pan, 27, was a lecturer in law at Warwick University in Coventry, England, until last month. Next month, he is to become an associate at Covington & Burling, the Washington law firm. He graduated magna cum laude from Harvard and received a master's degree in European politics from Edinburgh University in Scotland. His mother retired as a senior computer scientist for Westinghouse in Pittsburgh. His father was a research engineer in Pittsburgh for the Energy Department.
